title: R-045848 Residential Sales Specialist
description:
**Benefits Start Day 1 for Full-Time Colleagues - No Waiting Period!**  
For more information about our benefits, see below!

We are proud to be a member of the Rentokil family of companies, the global leader in Pest Control and other services across more than 90 countries. We pride ourselves on being a trusted partner to many of the world's leading brands and serve consumer and business customers across multiple industries. We are extremely proud of our legacy of excellence and constantly work to fulfill our mission to "protect people, enhance lives, and preserve the planet."

**What do our Residential Sales Specialists do?**  
The primary purpose of this role is selling the company's Residential Pest Management Services and Products to new and existing residential customers, while maintaining a customer-focused service to grow the business. This includes assessing customers' needs by performing a needs analysis based on customer concerns using expert knowledge of the company's products and services that result in the sales of the organization's pest control solutions.  
**Functions include, but are not limited to the following:**

* Assessing customers' needs by performing a needs analysis based on customer concerns using expert knowledge of the company's products and services and certifications.
* Visually inspects homes and businesses for pests, pest harborage, pest entries, etc
* Based on assessment findings, sell pest control solutions for residential customers.
* Collaborates with our customer service center, Inside Sales department, and technicians for increased opportunities
* Partners with Branch Manager to identify revenue streams with our current base and service specialist engagement Develop proposals for customers to resolve existing pest issues while also proposing additional enhancements to pest household services.
* Complete Home diagram using Sales CRM and provided to ensure clear understanding of customer home and possible challenges.
* Follow up on past proposals to close sales opportunities
* Provide expert knowledge to new service installations to ensure the job is completed satisfactorily
* Complete daily activities and sales performance using the company sales CRM

**What do you need?**

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Prefer Associate's or Technical degree
* Pest Industry certifications a plus
* Must have 1 or more years of sales or pest technician experience
* Prefer 1-2 years of experience in pest control sales and 2 or more years in a customer service role
* Must be an effective verbal communicator, with particular emphasis on customer-facing conversations and presentation with additional follow-ups
* Travel up to 100% of time within assigned territory(s)

The Life Set Team Supervisor is responsible for managing a team of (4) four Life Set Specialists who provide community based clinical and case management services

· Provide team oversight for specialists caring for Young Adults age 17-23 who are transitioning out of resource home care and need individualized skill development and support to transition successfully into adulthood.

· Ensure fidelity to the Agency’s service model and provide weekly supervision and consultation.

· Focus on specifically obtaining and maintaining safe and suitable housing, continuing education, learning independent living skills, obtaining and maintaining employment, building a support system, and remaining free from legal involvement.

· Training will be provided in an evidenced based model utilizing cognitive behavioral therapy and motivational interviewing.

· Supervisor is expected to go out into the field and requires a flexible schedule as well as participation in a 24/7 on-call rotation.

· Master’s Degree in social work, psychology, or human service field is required.

· Must have valid LSW, LPC, with a LCSW preferred.

· Must have supervisory experience and demonstrated effectiveness in leading a team.

· Strong organizational skills, strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with stakeholders and community providers is a must.

· A valid driver’s license with clean driving record is required.

· Bilingual preferred.

title: Assistant HR Consultant (New York Platform)
description:
About Acrisure:
Acrisure is a global Fintech leader that combines the best of humans and high tech to offer multiple financial products and services to millions of businesses and individual clients. We connect clients to solutions that help them protect and grow what matters, including Insurance, Reinsurance, Cyber Services, Mortgage Origination and more.
Acrisure employs over 17,000 entrepreneurial colleagues in 21 countries and have grown from $38 million to $4.3 billion in revenue in just over ten years. Our culture is defined by our entrepreneurial spirit and all that comes with it: innovation, client centricity and an indomitable will to win.
Job Summary:
The Assistant HR Consultant will assist the company’s HR Consulting division in providing client companies with consultation on matters typically assigned to the Human Resources function, including employment law compliance, policies and procedures. This position provides tactical and administrative support to the HR Consulting division in preparing client deliverables and work products. Support will also consist of assisting in the strategic integration of effective HR processes, programs and practices into clients’ daily operations, and maximizing the client’s performance by introducing “best practice” products or services. This position will also be responsible for assisting in overall marketing efforts and internal administrative functions.
Responsibilities:* Investigates and prepares work products for all assigned client inquiries and projects regarding basic HR concerns in a timely manner, and ensures the highest compliance and professionalism standards
* Prepares well-researched and meticulous responses to client inquiries, as well as various project deliverables, training presentations and other HR work products as assigned
* Assists in developing and implementing employee handbooks and other written policies and procedures
* Maintains a working knowledge of federal, state and local laws and regulations related to the Human Resources function including, but not limited to the FLSA, ADA, NLRA, FMLA, OSHA, ACA, ERISA/COBRA, HIPAA, Civil Rights Act of 1964, and provide clients with consultation accordingly
* Documents and maintains copious client HR records and metrics to provide feedback to clients
* Supports the marketing program development, creates marketing collateral and other branded sales materials, and assists in marketing execution to achieve key milestones and revenue goals
* Assists in preparation of proposals, contracts and consulting agreements for procurement of new business
* Directs clients to the appropriate tools and resources when necessary
* Maintains detailed hours and project tracking using the internal work management software
* Assists with basic accounting functions for the department, including requesting and generating invoices and managing billing systems
* Keeps abreast of HR trends, best practices, and technology solutions
* Participates in professional development sessions or seminars to further HR continuing education and maintains appropriate credentials
* Attends industry conferences, exhibitor events, and client meetings as assigned, and represents the company and HR Consulting division professionally
* Works on special projects and performs other duties as assigned

* Ability to communicate difficult and sensitive information tactfully, and provide simplified interpretation of information to clients in a comprehensible and concise manner
* Ability to work independently with little supervision required
* Ability to remain calm while working under pressure in a busy environment
* Ability to work within timeframe of standard policies and procedures and client expectations
* Ability to maintain confidentiality related to sensitive company and client information
* Thorough knowledge of HR principles and federal/state regulations
* Excellent ability to multi-task and prioritize in a busy, fast-growth environment
* Exhibit extraordinary discretion, confidentiality, flexibility, and willingness to work closely with our team
* Proficiency in MS Word, Excel and Power Point is essential


Travel Requirements
This position will require frequent travel to client locations predominantly in our region of New York, New Jersey, and Pennsylvania. Additionally, occasional travel by plane may be necessary for conferences or other work-related events throughout the year.

title: Compliance Manager
description:
**About the Firm:** R.F. Wilkins Consultants, Inc. is a New York-based Business Development and Management Consulting Firm. We partner with non-profits, small businesses, government agencies, and corporations to meet their development and expansion needs. Services under our umbrella include fundraising and capital sourcing, project management and technical assistance, marketing and branding, stakeholder engagement, and compliance. We are a growing, but nimble firm working strategically to meet our client’s goals. We have a close nit team working in a fast-paced environment. Our staff are our greatest asset; therefore, we encourage flexible working environments and continuous growth opportunities.

**About the Role:** Our client, a large government agency, is seeking a skilled Compliance Manager to create and implement a strategic plan aimed at improving its Minority & Woman-Owned Business Enterprises (MWBE) compliance monitoring program. This initiative focuses on research, developing a robust compliance and enforcement strategy, integrating this approach into existing procurement systems, and establishing mechanisms for tracking and reporting MWBE participation. The effort also includes crafting training materials and support structures for continuous compliance monitoring, offering customizable solutions to meet evolving standards, and employing tools for effective compliance and goal tracking. This MWBE program initiative is aligned with the agency's commitment to enhancing MWBE participation and supporting goals for equitable and inclusive procurement for MWBEs.

In this role, you would join our team at R.F. Wilkins and enjoy all the support and resources made available to our staff while being fully dedicated to the client's MWBE program. This is the ideal opportunity for an experienced MWBE compliance professional who is seeking to learn and grow, take on a complex and challenge, and work within a large government agency while benefiting from the teamwork, camaraderie, and support that we provide as a small consultancy of like-minded professionals dedicated to the development and growth of each of our team members. The Compliance Manager reports directly to the Senior Manager, Compliance and works closely day-to-day with agency project sponsors.

**Pay Range:** $45-$55 per hour

**Key Responsibilities and Duties:**

* Design and advise on the development of a comprehensive monitoring and enforcement strategy for MWBE compliance while integrating with existing procurement compliance structures
* Track and report MWBE participation, develop training materials, and establish a support framework for ongoing compliance monitoring
* Create tracking and reporting mechanisms for MWBE participation as subcontractors
* Customize solutions to adapt to evolving standards
* Perform in-depth analysis of current structures, systems, forms, and tools and advise on improvements, modifications, and/or adjustments
* Recommend utilization and/or integration to effectively and efficiently monitor MWBE subcontracting compliance, and develop a process and mechanism to confirm prime and subcontractor payments
* Create compliance monitoring training modules for MWBE program staff, scoped and sequenced to build depth of understanding and capacity
* Create quality assurance checkpoints for MWBE compliance monitoring
* Design MWBE compliance monitoring reports
* Conduct MWBE compliance monitoring as specified by the MWBE Compliance Team
* Periodically review contracts to ensure adherence to MWBE policies and progress toward goals

**We are looking for...**

* At least 8 years of experience in MWBE compliance monitoring and enforcement
* Proven experience designing and implementing compliance strategies within large, complex organizations, preferably within government
* Proficiency in developing and integrating compliance monitoring tools and reporting mechanisms
* Comprehensive understanding of MWBE laws and regulations
* Familiarity with procurement rules and policies
* Experience in establishing processes for verifying subcontractor payments, agreements, and performance
* Ability to conduct detailed reviews and audits to ensure adherence to MWBE policies
* Experience developing training modules and support frameworks for ongoing compliance monitoring

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45.00 - $55.00 per hour

Expected hours: 35 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* MWBE compliance: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Jamaica, NY 11432 (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* Jamaica, NY 11432: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Jamaica, NY 11432

title: Case Manager
company: West Harlem Group Assistance, Inc.-Community for Healthy Food Program
description:
The Case Manager under the supervision of the Director of Social Services, identifies and implements Social Services for vacate and fire disaster victims.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

**Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions for case manager.**

* Interviews families to determine needs and appropriate services with the goal of restoring the family's level of functioning as a unit.
* Establishes and maintains ongoing case records on all participating families.
* Analyzes case findings to determine if concrete needs have been addressed through appropriate referrals and that program activities corresponding to the expressed needs have been identified.
* Assists family in identifying their need for specific services and develops a mutually acceptable service plan.
* Identifies community organizations and agencies as potential resources for program development and implementation.
* Performs all other related duties as required.

**OTHER DUTIES**:

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

**Competencies:**

* Thoroughness
* Technical Capacity
* Time Management
* Communication Proficiency

**Supervisory Responsibilities:**

This position has no supervisory responsibilities

**Work Environment:**

This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.

**Position Type/Expected Hours of Work:**

The work hours are 35 hours a week. Generally the work hours are 9:00 am to 5:00 pm with 60 minutes for lunch to maintain full-time status.

**Travel Required:** Travel is primarily local during the business day.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* BA/BS degree in Social or Human Services.
* 2-3 years of experience working in a shelter environment and/or working with low-income households to develop independent living skills.
* Bilingual Skills (English/Spanish).
* Strong interest in Social Services.
* Knowledge of NYC housing and public benefits programs preferred
* Computer literacy in Microsoft Office, especially Outlook and Word
* Excellent written and oral communication skills. Knowledge of community resources and linkage.
* Highly motivated, well-organized, and flexible. Self-starter and pro-active disposition. Meticulous attention to details

title: DSP (Direct Support Professional)
company: Open Reach Associates in Mental Health & Disabilities Inc
description:
**About us**

Open Reach Associates in Mental Health & Disabilities Inc. is a dedicated provider of exceptional support services for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities (IDD). Our mission is to empower individuals to achieve their fullest potential and lead fulfilling lives within their communities.

We specialize in offering personalized Direct Support Services tailored to meet the unique needs and goals of each individual we serve. At Open Reach Associates, we believe in fostering an inclusive environment where everyone has the opportunity to thrive. Our team of compassionate and skilled professionals works closely with individuals and their families to develop and implement comprehensive support plans that promote independence, enhance daily living skills, and encourage community involvement..

Our work environment includes:

* Diverisity
* Inclusion

Job Title: Direct Support Professional

Open Reach Associates in Mental Health & Disabilities Inc is seeking compassionate and dedicated Direct Support Professionals (DSP) to join our team in Hopewell, NJ. The DSP will provide support and assistance to individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities (IDD) in home and in a community setting, helping them achieve their personal goals and improve their quality of life.

We are looking for DSP's that can work in Hopewell, NJ for up to 30 hours per week mornings 6am to 9pm and/or 3pm to 7pm.

**Responsibilities:**

* Provide direct care and support to individuals with IDD for community inclusion.
* Assist with daily living activities, including personal care, transferring from wheelchair.
* Promote and encourage independence and community involvement.
* Develop and maintain positive relationships with individuals, their families, and other team members.
* Implement individualized support plans and document progress.
* Ensure a safe and supportive environment for all individuals.

**Requirements:**

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Previous experience working with individuals with IDD is preferred but not required.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to build rapport
* Must be able to pass a drug screen & various background checks
* Reliable and punctual with a strong sense of responsibility.
* Must be available to transfer individual from wheelchair.
* Must have a driver's license.

Join our team as a Direct Support Professional to make a positive impact on the lives of individuals in our care. If you are passionate about providing quality support services and meet the qualifications outlined above, we invite you to apply for this fulfilling opportunity.

title: Staff Dentist
company: BMS Family Health and Wellness Centers
description:
Description:The Staff Dentist is responsible for providing a wide range of comprehensive dental services promoting preventative oral healthcare, diagnosis and treatment of diseases, injuries and malformation of teeth and gingiva. Patient population includes pediatric, adult, and geriatric patients. The Staff Dentist is responsible for proper documentation in the patient’s electronic dental record. The Staff Dentist reports all clinical aspects of the practice directly to the Dental Director.  
**Essential Functions and Duties**:

* Provide High quality dental care with the emphasis on preventive services to patients.
* Document all patient care information in the patient’s electronic dental record in a timely manner.
* Perform oral health evaluation and diagnosis. Develop treatment plans for patients and make referrals when appropriate to specialty care.
* Provide treatment consisting of preventative, periodontal, extractions, root canals, fillings, fixed and removable prosthetics to manage and/or eliminate dental disease, restore tooth function, and prevent future disease and/or dental caries.
* Obtain written consent for all procedures.
* Help with supervision of Dental Hygienist and Dental Assistants.
* Supervise the maintenance of equipment and the sterilization of instruments.
* Maintain a team approach to dentistry by assisting other dentists and staff to allow for efficiency, flow, and quality of dental care.
* Adhere to established clinical protocols and procedures.
* Adhere to all infection control standards.
* Follow established health center procedures for patient billing and reimbursement.
* Participate in quality improvement and peer review, management, and team meetings.
* Participate in staff medical education programs and patient health education activities as required.
* Maintain professional competence by completing appropriate specialty requirements of CME.

Requirements:

* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to handle patient emergencies within the department.
* Effective time management and communication skills.
* Working knowledge and comfort with electronic dental software and Microsoft Office software.
* Ability to maintain strict confidentiality.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to keep detailed records.
* Comprehensive knowledge of dental procedures, tools, and diagnostics.
* Fluent in languages of the population we serve preferable. (e.g., Spanish, French/Creole)

**Education and Experience:**

* Graduated from an accredited college of dentistry.
* Current and valid License to practice dentistry in the state of New York
* 1-2 years’ experience in general dentistry.
* Maintains a current DEA certificate.
* Infection Control Certification
* A valid and current BLS Certification

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $140,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Primary Care

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* On call
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: In person

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Linden Center for Nursing and Rehabilitationis looking for a Maintenance Technician to join the team at our Skilled Nursing Facility in Brooklyn, NY!

**Who We Are**


The Allure Group is a consortium of six rehabilitation centers across Brooklyn and Manhattan, NY, specializing in post-acute and sub-acute skilled nursing and rehabilitation. We pride ourselves in providing a high standard of care for patients of all ages and conditions, while upholding an environment of kindness, dignity, and respect for employees and residents alike. As a **Maintenance Technician** at The Allure Group, you would be part of a winning team doing meaningful work to improve the quality of life, health, and comfort of residents.

**Maintenance Technician Responsibilities**

* Perform daily inspections of machines and investigate, fix, and report any issues found
* Assemble and repair furniture, beds, wheelchairs, and bio-med equipment as necessary
* Perform basic HVAC maintenance and electrical repairs
* Ensure that daily activities in the facility can be performed without interruption
* Perform painting and related plastering repairs
* Assist in the removal of snow, ice, debris, etc.
* Adhere to and implement all facility safety and infection control policies

**Maintenance Technician Requirements**

* High school diploma or its equivalent

**Preferred**

* Prior experience in maintenance

**What We Offer**

* Competitive pay scale
* Medical, dental, and vision coverage
* 401k
* Paid time off
* CEU eligible training programs
* Ongoing leadership and professional development training
* Dedicated and local leadership support




Apply today! The opportunity for job satisfaction and growth for a Maintenance Technician position is here!

title: Groomer
description:
Create a healthier, brighter future for pets, pet parents and people!


If you want to make a real difference, create an exciting career path, feel welcome to be your whole self and nurture your wellbeing, Petco is the place for you.


Our core values capture that spirit as we work to improve lives by doing what’s right for pets, people and our planet.


* We love all pets like our own
* We’re the future of the pet industry
* We’re here to improve lives
* We drive outstanding results together
* We’re welcome as we are


Petco is a category-defining health and wellness company focused on improving the lives of pets, pet parents and Petco partners. We are 29,000 strong and operate 1,500+ pet care centers in the U.S., Mexico and Puerto Rico, including 250+ Vetco Total Care hospitals, hundreds of preventive care clinics and eight distribution centers. We’re focused on purpose-driven work, and strongly believe what’s good for pets, people and our planet is good for Petco.

**Job Summary:** As a Pet Stylist at Petco, you will be responsible for providing professional grooming services to our valued customers' pets. With your expertise and attention to detail, you will ensure that each pet receives exceptional care, leaving them looking and feeling their best. You will have the opportunity to showcase your grooming skills, creativity, and passion for animals in a dynamic and rewarding environment.

**Your Petco Grooming Career:**

* Competitive base pay, plus incentive
* Medical, dental, vision and more
* 401k and more
* Paid Time Off
* Petco Discounts
* All the supplies & equipment you need, including, clippers, blades, shears, shampoo, sprays, tools, etc.
* State of the art equipment, including bathing system, kennels, tables, and dryers
* Career development and growth opportunities, such as a Grooming Salon Leader, Grooming Mentor and Grooming Instructor

**Responsibilities:**

* Perform grooming services including nail trims, ear cleaning. bathing, brushing, haircuts, and styling, adhering to breed standards and pet owners' preferences.
* Safely and efficiently maintain & operate grooming tools and equipment such as clippers, shears, brushes, and dryers.
* Learn and follow Petco's grooming policies, standards and guidelines to ensure quality and consistency in all areas of the grooming business.
* Monitor pets for any signs of discomfort, illness, or injury, and promptly report any concerns to pet owners and store management.
* Assess and address each pet's individual needs, taking into consideration their coat type, skin condition, and temperament.
* Provide exceptional customer service by actively listening to pet owners' requests, offering grooming recommendations, and addressing any questions or concerns.
* Educate pet owners on grooming maintenance and at home care practices to promote the overall well-being of their pets.
* Collaborate with fellow groomers and store team members to create a positive and supportive work environment.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience as a professional groomer with a strong portfolio of successful grooming work.
* In-depth knowledge of various dog breeds, their grooming requirements, and common health issues & behaviors.
* Proficiency in breed-specific cuts, styling techniques, and grooming standards.
* Familiarity with grooming tools and equipment, and the ability to handle them safely and effectively.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, to interact confidently and professionally with pet owners and team members.
* Strong attention to detail, ensuring grooming services are executed accurately and to the highest standards.
* Physical stamina to stand for extended periods, lift and handle pets of different sizes, and perform repetitive grooming tasks.
* Compassion and patience when handling pets, ensuring their safety, comfort, and well-being throughout the grooming process.
* Flexibility to work weekends, evenings, and holidays based on the grooming schedule and customer demand.

**Note:** The Pet Stylist position at Petco offers an exciting opportunity to utilize your grooming expertise and passion for animals. Join our dedicated team of professionals, and together we will create a positive grooming experience for pets and their owners while upholding Petco's commitment to excellence in pet care.


Petco Animal Supplies, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, or any other protected classification.

*The pay ranges outlined below are presented in accordance with state-specific regulations. These ranges may differ in other areas and could be subject to variation based on regulatory minimum wage requirements. Actual pay rates will depend on factors such as position, location, level of experience, and applicable state or local minimum wage laws. If the regulatory minimum wage exceeds the minimum indicated in the pay range below, the regulatory minimum wage will be the minimum rate applied.*


$15.00 - $22.50
Hourly or Salary Range will be reflected above. For a more detailed overview of Petco Total Rewards, including health and financial benefits, 401K, incentives, and PTO -see https://careers.petco.com/us/en/key-benefits

title: Teacher Aide
description:
The purpose of the Teacher Aide position is to support school teachers and staff in providing a safe and secure environment for all faculty, staff and students.

**The Teacher Aide responsibilities will include but not be limited to the following:**

* Assist in monitoring safety of students
* Assist in gathering and escorting students to class
* Write daily reports as needed
* Monitor activity in hallways both during and between class times
* Supervise interactions among students and intervene to de-escalate a potential conflict
* Provide crisis prevention and intervention where appropriate
* Respond to crisis or emergency situations that may occur
* Escort students to other campus destinations
* Follow students in elopement or AWOL situations

**Successful candidates should be able to:**

* Establish positive relationships with children and staff & contribute to maintaining order
* Become familiar with and contribute to building routines and activities
* Act as a role model and exhibit a positive courteous attitude at all times
* Maintain a professional attitude and appearance at all times, practicing good judgment
* Have good attendance and work flexibly within the assigned school and tasks
* Physical condition commensurate with the demands of the job
* Ability and willingness to learn from training – especially Therapeutic Conflict Intervention Certification

**QUALIFICATIONS:** The minimum qualifications required for a Teacher Aide position are either graduation from high school, or possession of a New York Statehigh school equivalency diploma. A Teacher Aide should also have some combination of experience and training sufficient to indicate ability to do the required work.

**Salary**: $20.40 per hour.

title: Luxury Fitness Center Attendant & Lifeguard
description:
The Wright Fit
  
  

**The Pathway to an Extraordinary Quality of Life:** The Wright Fit has established itself as the premier Luxury Fitness and Amenities Management Company operating 24 and counting facilities in some of the most iconic residential and commercial buildings in Manhattan. By managing the facilities within residential and commercial buildings, we're given direct access into people's homes and workplaces, allowing us the opportunity to show them pathways to an extraordinary quality of life.
  
  

Job Summary
  
  

**The Wright Fit Team:**  

As an emerging leader in the fitness industry, there's no better place to gain first-hand experience at the crossroads of hospitality, health, wellness, and fitness. If you are a self-starter, customer focused, and a team player with a passion for fitness, then The Wright Fit is the right fit for you!
  
  

**Your Impact:**  

Our Luxury Fitness Center Attendants are responsible for delivering the highest quality customer service to all residents and guests through effective communication and extensive knowledge of The Wright Fit services and holistic approaches. Through relationship development, they will be able to proactively meet the needs of residents and guests and provide them with a platform to succeed!
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Provide high level customer service and hospitality to residents.
* Provide floor supervision and maintenance of the fitness center and equipment.
* Assist residents with any questions about the fitness center through knowledge of the equipment and services.
* Coordinate Personal training and other fitness services.
* Provide support to The Wright Fit specialists to ensure best service experience.
* Assist in organizing and managing events at the fitness center.
* Attentively and promptly respond to resident needs.
* Assist management in daily tasks and projects.
* Maintain a positive attitude and take initiative.
* Work as a cohesive team with all The Wright Fit team members to ensure efficiency and camaraderie.
* Maintain in conduct and actions The Wright Fit aesthetic, appearance, atmosphere, culture, vision, purpose and values.
* Compliance with quality assurance expectations and standards that may require you to sit, stand, or walk for extended periods of time, as well as lift and move heavy objects.
* Provide lifeguard services as required


**What we're looking for:**  

* Hospitality or Customer Service experience preferred.
* A passion for fitness, health, and wellness.
* Strong interpersonal, communication, and organization skills.
* Customer focused, able to manage conflict.
* Excellent time management, able to multi-task in a dynamic environment.
* Attention to detail, a self-starter and personally accountable.
* A positive attitude, team oriented.
* Ability to maintain the highest level of discretion and privacy.
* Attend and pass internal lifeguard certification.


**What you'll get:**  

* A supportive and passionate team of coworkers.
* Encouraging managers and leaders to learn from.
* Access to cutting edge information about the industry.


**Salary Range:** $20.00 Hourly
  
  

The Wright Fit is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. The Wright Fit does not discriminate on the basis of disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected under federal, state, or local laws.

description:

**Location: 50 Connell Drive Berkeley Heights, NJ 07922**

title: Anesthesia Veterinary Technician
company: Mosaic Animal Health Center Fair Haven
description:
**Position Summary:**

Are you a Veterinary Technician who is passionate about anesthesia and eager to share your expertise with a dynamic veterinary team? Mosaic Animal Health Center at St. Hubert’s (MSH) in Madison, NJ, is seeking a skilled and dedicated Anesthesia Technician. This role not only involves providing top-notch anesthesia care for our patients but also focuses on training and elevating our entire veterinary team to meet high anesthesia standards. Join us in a unique opportunity to enhance patient care and contribute to the professional growth of your colleagues.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Anesthesia Care:**

* Administer and monitor anesthesia for surgical and diagnostic procedures, ensuring the safety and comfort of our patients.
* Conduct pre-anesthetic assessments and prepare patients for anesthesia.
* Operate and maintain anesthesia equipment and supplies.
* Monitor patients’ vital signs during procedures and adjust anesthesia levels as needed.
* Provide post-anesthetic care and monitoring until full recovery.

**Training and Leadership:**

* Train and mentor veterinary technicians on anesthesia protocols and best practices.
* Develop and implement anesthesia training programs and materials.
* Collaborate with veterinarians and leadership to establish and maintain high anesthesia standards.
* Conduct regular assessments to ensure compliance with anesthesia protocols.

**Additional Responsibilities:**

* Assist in developing and updating anesthesia-related protocols and guidelines.
* Maintain accurate and detailed anesthesia records.
* Participate in continuous education and stay current with advancements in veterinary anesthesia.

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience as a Veterinary Technician with a focus on anesthesia.
* Strong knowledge of anesthesia protocols, equipment, and patient monitoring.
* Demonstrated ability to train and lead a team.
* Excellent communication and organizational skills.
* Compassionate and dedicated to providing high-quality patient care.
* Certification or licensing as a Veterinary Technician preferred.

**Why Join MSH?**

At Mosaic Animal Health Center at St. Hubert’s, we prioritize the well-being of our staff as much as the health of the pets we care for. Our mission is to deliver meaningful care in support of pet health, pet parents, our staff, and the animal welfare organizations we love to support. As part of our team, you will have the opportunity to make a tangible difference in the lives of pets and their families while advancing your professional skills and career in a supportive and engaging work environment.

Join us in our mission to create a vibrant, forward-thinking veterinary practice where both pets and people thrive. Please send applications and resumés to Abby.naranjo@mosaicatsthuberts.com. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Merchandise Processor
description:
About Williams-Sonoma - South Brunswick, NJ
  
  

Since it was founded in 1956, Williams - Sonoma has grown from Chuck Williams' single store in Sonoma, CA into one of the largest retailers in the country, with some best known and most beloved brands in home furnishings, including Williams - Sonoma, Pottery Barn and West Elm.
  
  

Our Distribution Centers serve as vital connections between factories and our retail, online and mail-order customers around the world. The Supply Chain environment is dynamic and fast-paced, and the network is expanding rapidly. If you have a background in distribution, manufacturing, engineering, transportation, finance, human resources or home delivery – and are looking for a job with a strong opportunity for gaining new skills and for advancement – our Supply Chain Organization could be just the place for you.
  
  

Williams-Sonoma, Inc Supply Chain Overview
  
  

In 2024, Williams-Sonoma was recognized as a Great Place to Work ® and Forbes Best Employers for Women and Diversity, honors which reflect that we are truly a people-first organization. Our operation includes:
  
  

* Over 4,000 Full-Time Associates across the Supply Chain
* 14.5M square feet of small parcel, personalization, furniture, and manufacturing space in the domestic US, Williams-Sonoma has developed an agile and capable distribution network consisting of the following:
* Large package / furniture distribution centers located in Southern California, Northern California, Texas, Georgia, and New Jersey totaling 9.2M square feet plus another 1.2M square feet of standalone final-mile furniture hubs.
* Small package eCommerce distribution centers located in Mississippi and Arizona totaling 3.2M square feet, consisting of over 1,000 full-time associates and 1,500 seasonal/temporary associates in Mississippi
* Sutter Street Manufacturing upholstery factories located in North Carolina and Mississippi totaling with over 1,400 full-time employees producing approximately $900 million to $1 billion in sales of upholstered furniture
* Transportation Department for Ocean, Air, Trucking, and Rail consisting of over 30 transportation professionals located in Memphis, TN
* 700 associates in our Sourcing offices in 10 countries in Asia and Europe including China, Vietnam, Singapore, India, Italy, and Turkey


The Merchandise Processor position is located in South Brunswick, NJ.
  
  

You'll be excited about this opportunity because you will....
  
  

* Receives and sorts products assigned to specific locations
* Uses warehouse system to determine all carton movement
* Utilizes an RF Gun for labeling appropriate cartons
* Flags materials with identifying information when needed
* Expert in their designated locations, reporting damages and incorrect settings, to ensure customer satisfaction
* Promote safety awareness and cultivate the safety culture throughout the company to avoid unsafe or hazardous working conditions
* Other duties as instructed


Check out some of the required qualifications we are looking for in amazing candidates….
  
  

* At least 6 + months of warehouse experience
* AS400 Warehouse Management system knowledge required
* Organized, detailed, and capable of multi-tasking
* Excellent attendance, and willingness to be part of a team – performing whatever duties are necessary
* Availability to work full time schedule which may include nights, weekends, holidays, etc
* Positive attitude, good work ethic, and strong communication skills


Review these physical requirements, as they play a major part in this role.
  
  

* Job requires continuous physical exertion- walking, bending, lifting, standing, climbing
* Must be able to lift 65 pounds minimum with or without accommodation


Our company benefits are second to none in the industry….
  
  

* Generous discount on all Williams-Sonoma, Inc. brand products
* 401(k) plan and other investment opportunities
* Paid vacations, Employee Assistance Programs, Time Off to Volunteer, Matching Gifts Community Service Program, and Holidays (in some locations)
* Health benefits, dental and vision insurance, including same-sex domestic partner benefits, Legal and Identity Protection Plans and Pet Insurance
* For more information on our benefits offerings, please visit MyWSIBenefits.com


EOE
  
  

At this time, we are not accepting referrals from third party recruiting agencies for this position.
  
  

This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.

title: 1:1 Teacher's Aide/Paraprofessional
description:
Manhattan Star Academy, a member of the YAI Network, provides Elementary Education for students 3-21 years of age with intellectual developmental disabilities and learning delays, including children on the autism spectrum.

Our mission is to provide high-quality services to children and their families in a comprehensive, developmentally based program which focuses on the whole child. Instructional activities integrate all the domains of child development, including physical development and health, and social/emotional development; communication, language, and literacy; cognition and knowledge of the world (math, science, social studies, the arts and technology). Our program strives to foster growth and development through a broad range of services within the program while utilizing community resources as appropriate.

Join us in working in a friendly environment that facilitates open communication and participatory management, where you are valued as a professional and where your opinion truly matters. Receive on-going state-of-the-art training, supportive supervision and a commitment to developing your education and career to help you reach your greatest potential as a professional!

title: Finance Director, M&A Integration
description:
Location: New York, NY, US
Careers that unlock the magic of human connection  

Pernod Ricard is a global premium spirits and wine company. We’re the team behind leading brands such as ABSOLUT® Vodka, Jameson® Irish Whiskey, Malibu®, Kahlúa® Liqueur, Beefeater® Gin, and Avión™ Tequila, as well as many more superior wines and exquisite champagnes!  

Working at Pernod Ricard is all about igniting conviviality in all that we do. Derived from the French word, convivialité…it means human connection, authenticity, friendly, and jovial. Conviviality is energy and spirit with a splash of je ne sais quoi and is a core philosophy around how we live and work at Pernod Ricard. Here, we are team players, dream makers, trailblazers, movers and (cocktail) shakers. We have a passion for living life to the fullest, making new friends every day, and realizing our potential as people and as a business! *The salary range for this role, based in New York* *is $164,480.00 to $215,880.00**.* *The range will vary if outside of this location. Base salaries are determined during our interview process, by assessing a candidate’s experience, skills against internal peers and against the scope and responsibilities of the position.*
Position Summary
The Finance Director, M&A Integration is a critical role within the Pernod Ricard USA Finance organization, overseeing the integration of recent acquisitions, leading partnership management workstreams, and guiding legacy M&A integration project prioritization and execution. This role will also support North American Distillers' strategic topics and manage project workstreams for brand company initiatives as needed. A thorough understanding of our end-to-end transaction process and timeline for integrating partner brands is essential. This position will interact cross-functionally and partner with multiple stakeholders (Operations, Accounting, Marketing, Portfolio Finance, Commercial Finance, Brand Entrepreneurs, Executives, PR HQ). The role requires strong influencing skills, developed leadership capabilities, finance expertise, and excellent communication.
The ideal candidate will possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a demonstrated ability to build relationships internally and with new brand partners. You should have a keen interest in taking charge of various processes and projects while driving efficiencies and standardization. This individual should be detail-oriented and able to grasp the big picture, as this role is crucial for our growth and strategy. This position reports to the VP Finance, North American Distillers Limited (NADL).
Major Responsibilities* Guide new brand integration for Pernod Ricard North America, ensuring the integration of newly acquired brands according to the Pernod Ricard Group timetable and integration strategy.
* Lead a team of two FTEs focused on M&A integration workstreams.
* Serve as the North American finance point of contact for the Founder (if any) and/or for PR stakeholders after the closing of an M&A transaction.
* Act as the PR USA liaison to the Global M&A team, supporting local market requests and M&A financial performance reviews for the PR Burex and/or Strategic Committee.
* Be the local PR USA expert regarding the parameters of executed M&A transactions.
* Advocate for the Finance Department on all finance-related topics during the integration phase of all new business.
* Work with executive sponsors and business leads to ensure each partner brand is properly scoped and chartered so that success can be measured.
* Guide business leads across North America in reviewing, discussing, and monitoring progress on key tasks, risks, and dependencies for assigned integration initiatives.
* Develop and maintain internal control structures and procedures for integration processes and documentation.
* Provide the Portfolio Finance team with business insights linked to the acquisition to strengthen the forecasting process.
* Coordinate the initial planning process and requirements with the new businesses.
* Work closely with the Operations team to ensure a holistic integration plan and execution.
* Review and ensure the accuracy of accounting records (both P&L and Balance Sheet) throughout the integration, in partnership with the North American Accounting team.
* Support and drive the execution of ad-hoc strategic projects for new and recent acquisitions.
* Aid in the integration process for previously executed acquisitions.
* Support and drive North American Distillers' strategic topics and project management.


Key Skillsets* A true business partner, able to confidently interact with other departments and balance key requirements and priorities to satisfy all stakeholders.
* A strategic thinker with impeccable judgment, execution capabilities, and people skills.
* Promotes best practices and appropriate governance in financial and accounting processes.
* Energetic, forward-thinking, and self-directed.
* Accountable and responsible for own outputs.
* Thorough approach with a high level of accuracy.
* Strong prioritization skills, with the ability to manage numerous and competing work streams simultaneously, to tight and often overlapping timelines.
* Highly analytical, with the ability to use facts to provide insight, make clear finance recommendations, and commercial decisions.
* Excellent communication and influencing skills, with the ability to communicate at all levels to a diverse range of stakeholders.
* Understands market dynamics and can clearly articulate strategic priorities from both finance and commercial perspectives.
* Strong accounting, project management, and integration skills.
* High attention to detail, while maintaining a view of the big picture and understanding the “why.”


Education & Experience Requirements* Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, or Economics; MBA or CPA preferred.
* Qualifications:
	+ A minimum of 8 years of relevant leadership experience in finance and operations.
	+ Excellent organizational skills with a structured approach and the capability to manage numerous and competing work streams simultaneously.
	+ Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills with the ability to adapt to different audiences.
	+ Demonstrates strong intellectual curiosity, always seeking new approaches and challenging the organization to achieve new levels of success.
	+ Experience leading cross functional workstreams or projects.
	+ Embraces cross-functional ways of working and strives to embed these practices in Pernod Ricard, championing our culture of entrepreneurship and conviviality.
	+ Strong sense of integrity and ethics.


When you join Pernod Ricard, you’ll experience a workplace that is rich in heritage, driven by our iconic brands and a long-standing commitment to sustainability, safety, and giving back to the people and communities where we work. We know that happiness at work starts with that feeling of belonging you get from an inclusive culture where being uniquely you is celebrated. Our values are lived, they drive our behaviors, and it’s what brings our culture to life.
Our work philosophy celebrates the magic of human connection with the flexibility needed to provide one's most meaningful contribution. We offer a flexible work policy, with most of our positions offering a hybrid or remote option. As a global employer, we understand that not everyone’s working hours are the same, and we empower our employees to work the hours that make the most sense for their and their team’s schedules.  

We offer employees great benefits and perks to toast to a life filled with support. Check out PRUSABenefits.com for details.  

Pernod Ricard USA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It employs qualified individuals based solely on ability, training, and experience, and does not and will not, discriminate for or against any employee or applicant for employment or promotion based upon actual or perceived race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, national origin, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, military service or any other classification protected by law. Offers will be subject to United States local terms.
Pernod Ricard USA is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Pernod Ricard USA will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations for the hiring process. To request reasonable accommodation during the application process, contact your talent acquisition manager.
Job Posting End Date:
Target Hire Date:
2024-08-16
Target End Date:

title: Finance Director, NADL Business Performance & Analysis
description:
Location: New York, NY, US
Careers that unlock the magic of human connection  

Pernod Ricard is a global premium spirits and wine company. We’re the team behind leading brands such as ABSOLUT® Vodka, Jameson® Irish Whiskey, Malibu®, Kahlúa® Liqueur, Beefeater® Gin, and Avión™ Tequila, as well as many more superior wines and exquisite champagnes!  

Working at Pernod Ricard is all about igniting conviviality in all that we do. Derived from the French word, convivialité…it means human connection, authenticity, friendly, and jovial. Conviviality is energy and spirit with a splash of je ne sais quoi and is a core philosophy around how we live and work at Pernod Ricard. Here, we are team players, dream makers, trailblazers, movers and (cocktail) shakers. We have a passion for living life to the fullest, making new friends every day, and realizing our potential as people and as a business! *The salary range for this role, based in New York* *is $164,480.00 to $215,880.00**.* *The range will vary if outside of this location. Base salaries are determined during our interview process, by assessing a candidate’s experience, skills against internal peers and against the scope and responsibilities of the position.*
Position Summary
North American Distillers Limited (NADL) is the newly formed global brand company within Pernod Ricard. NADL consists of Pernod Ricard’s North American distillation and bottling sites and is responsible for global oversight of Pernod Ricard’s US Whiskey brands: Jefferson’s, Skrewball, Rabbit Hole, TX Whiskey, and Smooth Ambler.
The position of Finance Director, NADL Business Performance & Analysis is a critical role, focusing on five core areas:* Monitor global business performance and reporting for the US Whiskeys; identify and address key risks and opportunities.
* Lead NADL and Pernod Ricard North American brand company financial analysis and reporting activities, including planning, brand company A&P monitoring, and executive deliverables (board, advisory committee, or leadership presentations).
* Provide decision support for global brand company stakeholders, including marketing and global business acceleration teams.
* Manage relationships with global stakeholders and local market affiliates.
* Develop a best-in-class team, driving clear responsibilities, development, and career planning (approximately 3 people).


Major Responsibilities / Accountabilities* Be the analytical engine of the NADL BP&A team:
* Prepare and analyze the global long-range strategic planning process for NADL brands.
* Understand the business environment to identify potential financial implications, ensuring timely and accurate information for key executive decision-making.
* Track monthly performance, recommend actions, and develop mitigation plans.
* Enable business partners for an agile and collaborative organization:
* Drive efficiency by managing the relevant teams through the Management Planning Cycles.
* Build sustainable, efficient, and effective systems in (i) ways of working and (ii) processes.
* Manage NADL Resources:
* Identify potential brand growth opportunities and make resourcing choices to drive optimal returns.
* Lead the development and execution of NADL export and business acceleration finance processes.
* Analyze spend versus budget/LE and previous years. Provide monthly analysis, identify key drivers of variances, and seek improvements in efficiency and effectiveness.
* Prepare strategic documents and presentations for PR USA senior management, board meetings, and other high-level strategic discussions.
* Handle special projects and assignments as required.
* Manage and develop direct reports with clear development plans and career mapping.


Nature & Scope
The role consistently interacts with executives, senior leaders, and managers across the company. The primary responsibility is to develop and oversee the execution of the brand strategic plan, support business reporting and analysis deliverables, and build new processes and ways of working for the NADL brand company.
The position is recognized for mastery in all aspects of financial and market performance management (analytics, reporting, and budgeting) and serves as a key strategic business partner. Due to the operations, marketing, and broader finance team, effective working relationships and communication across all levels of PRUSA and PR affiliates are essential, with a high level of confidentiality and discretion.
Embrace cross-functional ways of working and strive to embed these practices in the organization’s DNA. Champion Pernod Ricard's culture of entrepreneurship and conviviality.
Requirements* Education: Requires an undergraduate degree in Finance or a related field.
* Experience / Background: Minimum of 8 years of experience with a CPG/consulting company and a working knowledge of finance and marketing principles.


Key Skillset Required* Strong people management skills, including the ability and desire to lead, support, and develop direct reports.
* Excellent communication skills; ability to interact with and provide recommendations to senior stakeholders.
* Detail-oriented strategic thinker.
* Highly analytical, with the ability to use facts to provide insight and make clear financial recommendations and commercial decisions.
* Thorough approach with a high level of accuracy.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment, managing multiple work streams simultaneously.
* Capable of confidently interacting with non-finance departments and brand founders, understanding their key requirements, and tailoring financial data to meet these needs.
* Strong influencing skills, proactive in challenging and influencing the business based on insight, knowledge, and facts.
* High proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, and finance software(s).
* Ability to understand business dynamics and clearly articulate strategic priorities from a finance perspective.
* Team player with the capability to translate effectiveness across the wider team.
* Ability to grow high-talent teams.


Person Specification* Personable, with the ability to interact across the organization while delivering a high level of customer service.
* Highly motivated and able to work autonomously.
* Accountable and takes responsibility for own outputs.
* Capable of prioritizing and making clear choices.
* Growth mindset with openness to change.
* Good relationship-building and communication skills.


When you join Pernod Ricard, you’ll experience a workplace that is rich in heritage, driven by our iconic brands and a long-standing commitment to sustainability, safety, and giving back to the people and communities where we work. We know that happiness at work starts with that feeling of belonging you get from an inclusive culture where being uniquely you is celebrated. title: Maintenance Technician
description:

We are currently seeking an experienced Maintenance Technician with a strong background in multi-family residential maintenance. The Maintenance Technician will handle all aspects of the property’s maintenance, including the physical grounds, ensuring curb appeal through interior and exterior building inspections, grounds maintenance, and preventive maintenance. description:
Client Service Representative  

  

We are seeking an experienced Client Service Representative to join our team.  

  

Why We Need You  

As the face of OCVH, the Client Service Representative sets the tone for the practice as we build and maintain each customer's trust and confidence in our abilities. The CSR is the pivot around which the hospital operates and is responsible for:  

* Customer service functions, including: greeting visitors, answering telephones, and guiding clients and their pets to exam rooms.

You will manage a portfolio of school accounts in Staten Island and will serve as the liaison between volunteers and the schools. The primary focus will be on relationship management and program execution. This includes recruiting, training, placing, and supporting volunteers, and requires time spent out in the field running volunteer events and being a visible presence to our partners. You will build relationships with assigned schools to strengthen our collaborative efforts to bring JA programs to their students and will participate in assigned projects and special events.

With a growing number of new schools interested in JA programming, you will be tasked with onboarding those schools, continuing those relationships and making sure that the quality of the programming lives up to JA New York standards. The Part-Time Program Associate (NYC Programs: Staten Island) will report directly to the Associate Director, New York City Programming.

* Ensure Quality – Implement programs in line with JA New York standards and increase their value to constituents. • Manage Relationships with Staten Island Partners – Build, manage and strengthen assigned relationships, expand programming to new partners which will include actively promoting and marketing the program to schools, educators, prospective sponsors, volunteers and potential funders.
* Manage Projects – Successfully manage assigned programmatic projects, including coordinating participation of volunteers and students in JA New York events based on Staten Island
* Recruit & Train – Successfully conduct training sessions for external constituents including educators and volunteers.

* Currently pursuing or completed Associate or Bachelor’s Degree
* Evidence of very strong oral communication/presentation skills
* Desire to work in a youth-oriented non-profit organization

* Ability to troubleshoot and do well under pressure
* Ability to work in a team setting

* Prior teaching experience

title: Warehouse Material Handler - 1st Shift
description:
**Requisition ID:** 54059  

**Position Type:** (US)Full Time  

**Workplace Arrangement:**


**About Kerry**
---------------


Kerry is the world's leading taste and nutrition company for the food, beverage and pharmaceutical industries. Every day we partner with customers to create healthier, tastier and more sustainable products that are consumed by billions of people across the world. Our vision is to be our customers' most valued partner, creating a world of sustainable nutrition. A career with Kerry offers you an opportunity to shape the future of food while providing you opportunities to explore and grow in a truly global environment.**Where you'll work:**
----------------------



Our Clark location creates flavor ingredients and beverages for Kerry customers and brands. We are a fast paced, never a dull moment manufacturing facility with a culture of accountability and teamwork. We’re proud of where we live and actively participate in community activities. If you've got an eagle eye for quality and are looking for a team to develop and grow with then this job might be the one for you!

  


**1st shift opening, must be able to work 6:00AM - 2:00PM!**


**What you'll do:**
-------------------



As a Material Handler you'll be responsible for securely transporting finished goods and raw materials between the receiving docks, storage areas, production, packaging, warehouse and the shipping docks. You'll utilize a computer and RF Scanner to track product, materials and shipments and have the opportunity to work alongside our truck drivers to make sure our finished goods and raw materials are kept in good order!

  


You’ll be a key part of a high performing team that keeps production lines running efficiently while working together to ensure we all have a safe workplace. We’ll count on you to help us meet our customer and consumer needs as you:

  


* Move and transfer ingredients by hand, cart, pallet jack, or forklift (don’t worry, we’ll train you if not certified)
* Document temperature and machine readings with accuracy – your attention to detail will be key here
**What you'll need to be successful and safe:**
-----------------------------------------------


* Are you able to carry 50 lbs, stand for extended periods of time, and work at heights using a scissor-lift? We care about your safety, so you’ll need to pass a pre-work physical as part of a safety check.
* Do you have experience driving a forklift? The safety of our team and products are our top priority, so we prefer a year of experience behind the wheel.
* Do you know the value of a great team? Teamwork is one of our values and critical to everyone’s success.  

Because you’ll be part of a team that will count on you, we’d like to see solid work attendance in your current/previous job.

  




The typical hiring range for this role is $20.00 per hour and is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications. This position may also be eligible for a shift differential and/or overtime. In addition to your pay, Kerry offers benefits such as a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and retirement contribution (all benefits and incentives are subject to eligibility requirements).



Kerry is an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Kerry will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditional upon the successful completion of a background investigation and drug screen. Additional information can be found at: Know Your Rights: Workplace Discrimination is Illegal (dol.gov).


Beware of scams online or from individuals claiming to represent us. A Kerry employee will not solicit candidates through a non-Kerry email address or phone number. In addition, Kerry does not currently utilise video chat rooms (e.g., Google Hangouts) to conduct interviews. Refuse any request that asks you to provide payment to participate in the hiring process (e.g., purchasing a “starter kit,” investing in training, or something similar). Kerry will not ask you to pay any money at any point in the hiring process with the exception of reimbursable travel expenses. In addition, any payments made by Kerry will be from official firm accounts bearing the Kerry name.

title: RN Supervisor, Specialized Donor Program (Leukopaks)
description:
***Why Choose Us?***   
As one of the nation’s premier humanitarian organizations, the American Red Cross is dedicated to helping people in need throughout the United States and, in association with other Red Cross networks, throughout the world. When you join our team, you have a direct impact on a meaningful mission, and you can help save lives every day. If you share our passion for helping people, join us in this excellent career opportunity. ***Work where your career is a force for good.***

We are committed to the diversity of our workforce and to delivering our programs and services in a culturally competent manner reflecting the communities we serve. Our work environment is collaborative, respectful, and inclusive with a focus on building allyship and a culture of belonging that empowers all team members. Come to learn, grow, and succeed while sharing your passion for making a difference.

The Red Cross supports a variety of cultural and community resource groups for employees and volunteers. From the Ability Network, our Asian American & Pacific Islander Resource Group, the Latino Resource Group, and Red Cross PRIDE, to the Umoja African American Resource Group, our Veterans+ Resource Group, and the Women’s Resource Group, these networks provide connections, mentoring and help give voice to important concerns and opinions.

At the American Red Cross, your uniqueness can shine!

**OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE:**

Manage the daily operations of the Leukopak/Specialized Donor Program through staff supervision, maintaining quality standards, and supporting procedures to ensure efficiency, effectiveness, and safe operations.

**WHERE YOUR CAREER IS A FORCE GOOD:**

* Manage the daily operations of the Leukopak collection sites which may include staff assignments, supply inventory, coordinating with internal and external customers, and overseeing activities and collections for the Specialized Donor Program
* Supervise staff including hiring, training, coaching, mentoring, evaluating, and disciplining to ensure a well-qualified team, reduce turnover, enhance operational success and compliance, and ensure safe and appropriate care of donors.
* Perform / assist with Leukopak prescreen and collection procedures, ensuring compliance with internal and external protocols and procedures.
* Respond to and resolve time-sensitive issues. Report non-conformances and contribute to the investigation and implementation of corrective actions for customer concerns and non-conformances, as needed.
* Ensure effective internal and external communication between applicable departments, functions and geographies related to the Leukopak program.

***WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED:***

* ***Must hold a current RN license.***
* Medical or nursing, Management, or related field required.
* Current CPR certification is required.
* 1 year of lead or supervisory experience.
* Excellent organizational skills, the ability to handle multiple priorities effectively, analyze problems and recommend appropriate solutions, and the ability to assimilate information quickly.
* Excellent written and oral communication skills are necessary to deal with staff, donors, and internal and external customers.
* Phlebotomy experience required.
* A current valid driver’s license and good driving record is required.
* Ability to work on a team.
* Some travel may be required.

**WHAT WILL GIVE YOU THE COMPETITIVE EDGE:**

* Previous apheresis or dialysis experience is highly desirable.

***What is Leukopaks:***

Leukapheresis is the collection of leukocytes — also known as white blood cells or immune cells. A donor reclines in a chair and blood is drawn through a vein in one arm. An apheresis machine removes white blood cells from the superfluous biofluids, separates them based on density, and collects them in a collection bag known as a leukopak. The remaining red blood cells and platelets are then returned to the same donor through a vein in their other arm. (The white blood cells that have been removed will be replaced quickly.) The white blood cells collected are frequently referred to as peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs), and contain B cells, T cells, stem/progenitor cells, and dendritic cells. Leukapheresis allows for a concentrated, pure method to obtain PBMCs from a single individual donor.

Leukopaks are used when many PBMCs are needed from an individual donor, such as drug screening (immuno-oncology and non-oncology), cell therapy (research and development), and gene therapy. Sourcing healthy donor PBMCs allows for the use of single donor cell populations with greater viability and less inter- and intra-assay variability, as well as to development of well-characterized methods of production for autologous therapies (cell therapies where a patient’s cells are modified for treatment). For these cell therapy developments, large numbers of PBMCs sourced from a single donor are important for creating relevant biological assays, as well as for quality control testing. In these cases, healthy donors are matched to patients in terms of demographic criteria, such as age and gender, and physiological criteria like HLA type, which can provide valuable insights into the progress of the patient’s autologous cell therapy.

***BENEFITS FOR YOU:***

We take care of you, while you take care of others. As a mission-based organization, we believe our team needs great support to do great work. Our comprehensive benefits help you in balancing home and work. With our resources and perks, you have amazing possibilities at the American Red Cross to advance the learn.

* Medical, Dental Vision plans
* Health Spending Accounts & Flexible Spending Accounts
* PTO + Holidays
* 401K with 4% match
* Paid Family Leave
* Employee Assistance
* Disability and Insurance: Short + Long Term
* Service Awards and recognition

title: Registered Nurse (RN)
description:
Come join our team! The BronxCare Special Care Center is currently recruiting for a Staff Registered Nurse position to work in our 240 bed Skilled Nursing Facility. All candidates must possess a current New York State license as a Registered Professional Nurse. (At least two years of clinical nursing experience and one-year geriatric experience)

**GENERAL OBJECTIVES:**

The primary function of the Registered Nurse is to control unit operations and carry out any special tasks in the realm of your capabilities as directed by the Nurse Manager/Supervisor.

**SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Complete assessment to all residents quarterly and PRN such as: pain assessment, fall assessment and skin assessment.
* Perform dressing change including wound assessment and wound vac.
* Insert IV PRN
* Does treatments, dispenses medications, and performs other nursing functions as needed on a regular basis.
* Delegate these duties to another Nurse, LPN, assigned to your unit.
* Assign and supervise the activity of Nursing Assistants to assure that residents receive adequate assistance with personal hygiene and in carrying out activities of daily living.
* Assure that documentation regarding significant change in resident activity, eating habits, mental orientation, emotional status, and physical condition is made in resident medical record.
* Assure that physician orders are carried out.
* Secure the service of the residents’ attending physician when indicated.
* Assure that medication is being given as prescribed and according to nursing policy.
* Maintain and revise CCP as applicable, addressing problems, formulating approaches and developing goals. Complete sections of MDS as assigned by nurse supervisor.
* Inform the Physician orders are transcribed and carried out in a timely manner.
* Prepare the 24-hour report and present it to the Nursing Supervisor. Apprise the Nursing Supervisor of developments regarding residents’ condition.
* Develop and maintain a good working relationship with intra-department personnel as well as other departments within the facility to assure that nursing services and activities can be adequately maintained to meet the need of the resident.
* Assist in developing and maintaining nursing objectives and standards. Make written/oral recommendations to the Director of Nursing Services.
* Visit each resident at least twice during the work shift to assure that appropriate care is being rendered.
* Ensure that each resident’s right to fair and equitable treat, determination, individuality, privacy, property and civil rights, including the right to wage a complaint is followed by all personnel.
* Create and maintain an atmosphere of warmth, personal interest and positive attitudes as well as a calm environment throughout the unit/shift.
* Assure that established infection control procedures and isolation techniques are followed at all times.
* Participate and assist in departmental studies and projects as assigned or that may become necessary.
* Exercise proper judgment; follow lines of communication within the framework of professional principles.
* Posses the ability to deal tactfully with personnel, resident/patient’s, family members, visitors, government agencies/personnel and the general public.
* Is knowledgeable of nursing and medical practices and procedures, as well as laws, regulations, and guidelines pertaining to ling-term care.
* Possess leadership ability and the willingness to work harmoniously with the supervision of professional and non-professional personnel.
* The ability to plan, organize, develop, implement, and interpret the programs, goals, objectives, policies, procedures, etc., of the Nursing Service Department.
* Maintain the care and use of supplies, equipment, etc., and maintain the appearance of nursing areas, must perform regular inspections of nursing units for sanitation, order, safety and proper performance.
* Encourage and enforce safe work practices by staff training, proper role modeling, positive reinforcement, and correction of unsafe performance. Proper work procedures reinforced with warnings and notices, when appropriate.
* Utilize personal protective equipment to present chemical/infectious exposure. Utilize proper equipment and procedures to prevent accidents.
* Recognize potential hazards and implement safe procedures in the work area.
* Ability to use and has knowledge of oxygen, suction machines, wheelchairs, stretchers, etc., syringes and medications, audio-visual aides, clerical forms relating to nursing services.
* Conduct detailed incident/ accident investigations and complete documentation of specific incidences to identify root case and means for prevention.
* Identify, prevent and intervene appropriately in potential incidences of violence. Identify and demonstrate safe handling techniques of the unpredictable resident/patient.
* Knowledge and adherence to The Facility Sexual Harassment and Workplace Violence policies.
* Knowledge and adherence to The Facility Hazard Communication policies and is familiar with location of MSDS information pertinent to position held.
* Understand and report all resident/patient/family concerns or grievances in accordance with The Facility.
* Demonstrates knowledge, respect and sensitivity of resident’s rights as identified within the Resident Bill or Rights and facility policy and mission statement. Assures confidentiality of all resident information.
* Attends in-service education as required by position title.
* Performs related duties as required.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

As required by the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)

a. To be able to walk about

b. To be able to climb stairs

c. To be able to carry approximately 5-10 lbs. (documents)

d. Must possess visual and auditory acuity with or without assistive/corrective devices.

e. Must exhibit the ability to communicate (transmit and receive) verbal and written information in an effective time and efficient manner.

f. Must exhibit the physical ability to provide the full scope of required job tasks. This includes but is not limited to lifting, prolonged and sitting and repetitive movements.

g. Must demonstrate the ability to comprehend verbal and written instructions and follow through with logical plan and course of action.

h. Must demonstrate the ability to perform assigned tasks independent without the need for constant re-direction.'  
'
