title: Driver, Swing
description:
A leader in technology and innovation, Southwire Company, LLC is one of North America’s largest wire and cable producers. Southwire and its subsidiaries manufacture building wire and cable, utility products, metal-clad cable, portable and electronic cord products, OEM wire products and engineered products. In addition, Southwire supplies assembled products, contractor equipment, electrical components, hand tools and jobsite power and lighting solutions. The company also offers digital solutions including contractor planning and utility grid resiliency as well as field services including cable testing, rejuvenation and replacement to support our customers as a value-add partner. We are proud to offer competitive compensation, employee benefits, tuition reimbursement and unlimited growth opportunities. Our more than seven decades of progressive growth can be attributed to our determination to developing innovative systems and solutions, exercising environmental stewardship and enhancing the well-being of the communities in which we work and live. How will you power what’s possible?


Location: Monroe Township, NJ


Shift: 6AM-2PM


Pay Rate: $24.58 – $26.21

**Job Description**
-------------------

**Position Overview:**


Responsible for the transporting of goods from warehouse and distribution centers to customer locations and the picking up of goods from various locations including customers, suppliers and pier.

**Essential Job Functions:**


Perform inspections on trucks before and after a trip, unload products from the truck to customer facilities. Follows appropriate safety procedures to transport cargo and maintain logs of vehicle repair status and working hours according to DOT regulations.  

Assists workers in loading and unloading trucks. Checks mechanical, electrical and operational aspects of the vehicle. Manages proof of delivery paperwork from customers when delivering and picking up of product. Mark materials with identifying information using appropriate method. Open bales, crates, and other containers. Record amounts of materials or items received or distributed. Identify damage, loss, or surplus of goods and materials. Count items for distribution to ensure conformance to company standards. May be assigned truck maintenance duties as needed. Complete requisition forms to order supplies for vehicle. Sweep, dust, and clean truck to ensure clean and safe work environment. Organize truck and work area for orderliness at all times. Any duties as assigned.

**Required Skills/ Qualifications:**


Valid CDL Driver’s License; maintains compliance with DOT regulations. Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports, fill out forms/docs, correspondence and update paperwork accordingly. Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Safety (MSDS) training. Has good communication and customer service skills at all times.  

Able to work independently. Has a good knowledge of roads, trucks, routes, trucking rules, DOT requirements and CDL. Works well under pressure. Good work ethic.

**Education/ Experience Requirements:**


High school diploma or general education degree (GED); Must have attended a training program from a technical or vocational school in order to learn suitable skills and knowledge to obtain the Commercial Driver ́s License (CDL) in order to drive trucks or other types of vehicles carrying loads with a weight over 26,001 pounds. Minimum of one year CDL driving experience.

**Required Competencies:**


Physical/Mental Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear.  

The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. The employee is occasionally required to sit and climb or balance. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to ten pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to fifty pounds, and occasionally lift and/or move more than one hundred pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.  

Work Environment: While performing the duties of this job, the employee regularly works near moving equipment and will be working in non-controlled environmental conditions. The noise level in the work environment is usually very loud. This position requires the employee to work in an outdoors environment. Conditions include, but are not limited to, hot, humid summer-like conditions and cold/winter conditions.  

Roads are subject to become wet/slick when raining and or snowing.


Benefits We Offer:

* 401k with Matching & Pension Plan (Eligible for Pension after 1,000 Hours Worked)
* Family and Individual Insurance Packages (Health, Life, Dental, and Vision)
* Paid Time Off & Paid Holidays
* Long & Short-Term Disability
* Supplemental Insurance Plans
* Employee Assistance Program
* Employee Referral Program
* Tuition Reimbursement Programs
* Advancement & Professional Growth opportunities
* Parental Leave
* & More


Southwire is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Counsel, Commercial Transactions
description:
**Counsel, Commercial Transactions**
About the Job
Madison Energy Infrastructure (“MEI”) believes in the power of clean energy infrastructure and has quickly emerged as a preeminent developer, investor, asset owner, and operator of distributed generation. This role represents a critical next step in MEI’s evolution toward offering direct, end-to-end services to Fortune 500 corporates, public entities, nonprofits, and other private customers alike.

The Counsel, Commercial Transactions will take the lead on drafting, reviewing and negotiating transaction documents for new project acquisitions, PPAs with customers and EPC agreements with construction partners. The ideal candidate will be commercially minded and serve as an advisor and strategic partner to other members of the transactional team, and will play a crucial role in securing new project acquisition and development. The Counsel, Commercial Transactions will need to balance those duties, while leading the diligence and closing processes for all external parties including, but not limited to, developers, EPCs, tax equity investors and lenders. This position requires strong analytical and communication skills, and the ability to juggle multiple, competing priorities on a regular basis.
### **What you'll be doing**

* Lead project due diligence and negotiation from Letter of Intent to final execution of all transactional and project documentation. This includes the documentation listed below.
* Manage corporate governance and risk management.
* Negotiate with external financing partners including, but not limited to, lenders, tax equity investors and MEI’s investors.
* Review and negotiate supply agreements with vendors.
* Work directly with other teams across the company to ensure MEI is set up for success over the long-term project.
* Engage and oversee external counsel and contractors as necessary.
* Review, negotiate and prepare various corporate and transactional documents, including: Membership Interest Purchase Agreements and Asset Purchase Agreements, Power Purchase Agreements, Subscriber Agreements and Energy Service Agreements, EPC Agreements, O&M Agreements, Utility Interconnection Agreements, Land & Site Leases (including easements, licenses, etc.), SPV Corporate Formation Documents, Assignments & Estoppels, Letters of Intent/Term Sheets, Corporate and Board Resolutions, Tax Equity Partnership Documents, and Loan Agreements.

### **What We Are Looking For:**

* Juris Doctor from a reputable law school and an active state bar registration.
* 3+ years of experience at a top law firm, including experience leading transactions.
* Experience closing complex transactions involving multiple parties under aggressive timelines.
* Experience preparing and negotiating a broad range of corporate documents and transactional agreements.
* Experience in the solar industry is a plus.

*Actual salary offered may vary depending on job-related factors including, but not limited to, knowledge, skills, experience, and location.**Madison Energy Investments is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.*

title: Inventory and Organization Specialist- Crumbl Chelsea
description:
Crumbl Cookies in Chelsea is looking for a person who can work a 4-5 hour shift starting late morning to early afternoon. This position includes putting away large ingredient orders and organizing them within the store. Hiring immediately. Needs to be available at least Tuesday and Saturday. Need to be able to work quickly and efficiently and have a good eye for organization. Also, needs to be able to lift 50+ lbs. Free cookies included!
  
  

Thanks for your interest! We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Bread Baker
description:
She Wolf Bakery, a Brooklyn breads bakery that works exclusively with local, organic grains and specializes in naturally fermented doughs is hiring a Baker. We offer:

* Competitive wages
* Subsidized medical, dental, and vision insurance at 90 days
* Access to our 401k plan + company match starting at hire
* Industry leading paid time off plans + paid parental leave
* Discounts across our group of businesses
* Access to our Employee Emergency Assistance Fund


We’re looking for someone with a passion for naturally leavened bread and experience in a professional kitchen setting. The ideal candidate will have worked for at least one year in pastry or baking, be dedicated to their craft, possesses strong communication skills, and respect both the people and ingredients with which they work. This position will require you to work weekends and some holidays. We don’t bake overnight, but our first shift starts at 3 AM and this hire will be required to work 1-2 of those shifts per week.  

  

She Wolf Bakery is part of The Marlow Collective, a group of Brooklyn food businesses including the restaurants Diner, Marlow & Sons, Roman's, and Achilles Heel, the butcher and grocery shop Marlow & Daughters, Stranger Wines & Spirits, and Marlow Events. As part of our mission of sustainability on all fronts, we are committed to providing the best possible work environment for our employees, to sourcing seasonally, locally and organically and building unique and lasting partnerships with our farmers and producers, and to creating outstanding food and experiences that highlights these connections. This position is an opportunity to grow your career and learn with us in a dynamic, values-driven company.  

  

While performing the duties of the job, a Baker is regularly required to stand and walk; reach with hands and arms; talk and hear; climb, balance, stoop, kneel, and crouch. They must regularly lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.  

  

The Marlow Collective wage band for this position is set at $18.50- $22.50  

Bakers begin at $19/ hr or $20/ depending on experience.


More detail about She Wolf Bakery part of The Marlow Collective

title: Baker- Crumbl Chelsea
description:
**Crumbl Cookies** is a fast-growing national brand that is changing the way people experience and enjoy cookies. We are proudly building a reputation consisting of incredible tasting cookies while providing a clean, safe and welcoming environment! This reputation is only possible with an individual who is passionate and dedicated to offering world class cookies, serving the team and customers, while having a strong desire to grow and learn.  

**START DATE: ASAP**  

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Read and understand Crumbl recipes
* Measure and combine ingredients using mixers, ovens, and other equipment to make cookies
* Decorating and displaying the finished product
* Ensure finished goods meet food safety and quality controls
* Greeting customers, answering questions, making recommendations, accepting orders and payment, and providing exceptional customer service
* Cleaning and restocking the workstation and store, and ensuring all equipment is sanitized

  

**Requirements:**
* Come to shift on time, prepared, and follow Crumbl policies
* Pleasant interactive skills, time and resource management, and planning skills
* Attention to detail, especially when performing quality inspections on ingredients and products
* Basic math and computer skills
* Willingness to work independently or with other team members to solve problems, fulfill orders, and create excellent baked goods
* Energetic and able to work in a fast-paced environment

  

**Lots of Benefits:**
* TIPS! Our bakers usually make $2-3 in tips per hour
* Opportunity for growth in the company
* Sampling Cookies
* Free cookies (weekly limits apply)
* Flexible Scheduling
* Sundays Off
* Leadership opportunities to gain real world management experience

  

  

**We ask you to...**
* Have a cheerful and positive attitude - Smile!
* Make emotional connections with guests, use good eye contact
* Love helping and serving others
* Honors and encourages others to follow the values and policies of Crumbl
* Ability to multitask quickly, yet thoroughly
* Be consistent and reliable
* Have the ability to communicate effectively in English
* Be at least 18 years of age for this job
* Be willing and able to work a flexible schedule
* Have the ability to lift and carry 10-55 lbs.
* Have reliable transportation
* Wear a clean uniform properly at each shift.

  

**Applicants will also be expected to be able to work on their feet for several hours at a time and lift potentially heavy objects when necessary. Prior experience is preferred, but not necessary.**
**We look forward to hearing from you! Thanks for applying! :)**

title: Breakfast Supervisor
description:
NoHo Hospitality Group is in search of a SUPERVISOR to join our team at LEUCA.
  
  

Inspired by Southern Italy, Leuca is a neighborhood restaurant from Chef Andrew Carmellini's NoHo Hospitality Group serving house-made pastas, wood-fired pizzas and rustic dishes in a sunlit corner space in Williamsburg..
  
  

The Supervisor will be an exemplary member of the company's hospitality philosophy. This is a floor position, and a great way to move up into management.
  
  

**Who you are:**  

1. Someone who loves Hospitality!
  
2. Has previous experience in a fine dining concept or luxury hotel environment.
  
3. Great communicator.
  
4. Strong leader on the floor and for employees.
  
5. Manages with Empathy.
  
  

**Duties include, but are not limited to:**  

1. Foster and maintain positive employee and guest relations at all times, ensuring guest satisfaction.
  
2. Anticipate guests’ needs, respond promptly and acknowledge all guests, however busy and whatever time of day.
  
3. Responsible for being the ambassador of hospitality for all services. Must also ensure that everyone who enters the restaurant, hotel, or any F&B outlet, or calls to make a reservation is made to feel welcome.
  
4. Identify guest by the surname (when identified) within each exchange (in person or over the phone) while also addressing them with the correct salutations, such as “Miss,” “Sir,” “Ma’am,” or “Senator,” etc.
  
5. Foster and promote a cooperative working climate, maximizing productivity and employee morale.
  
6. Be responsible for the supervision and service of all meal periods.
  
7. Assist in supervising and managing all F&B employees.
  
  

**Benefits:**  

We offer medical, dental, and vision benefits after 90 days of employment for full time employees, as well as a 401(k), Short Term Disability, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, Employee Dining Discount, Zip Car Discount, Spa Discount, TransitChek, Corporate Fitness Program, Continuing Education Classes and Referral Reward Program.
  
  

Since first partnering in 2009, chef Andrew Carmellini, Josh Pickard and Luke Ostrom have opened a national portfolio of restaurants and culinary services at preeminent hotels, live music venues and major metropolitan sports arenas and airports across New York City, Baltimore and Detroit including Locanda Verde, The Dutch, Joe’s Pub and The Library at The Public, Lafayette, Bar Primi, Little Park, Leuca, Westlight, Mister Dips, Rec Pier Chop House, The Cannon Room, Rye Street Tavern, San Morello, Evening Bar, The Brakeman and Penny Red's. The team runs food and beverage operations in six hotels, including The Greenwich Hotel, AKA Tribeca, The William Vale, Sagamore Pendry Baltimore and the Shinola Hotel. Known for delivering quality experiences and pertinent culinary culture, each place is a distinctly owned, handcrafted labor of love. They've received widespread critical acclaim, recognition on countless “Best of” lists, a Michelin star, and two coveted James Beard Foundation awards. To learn more, visit nhgnyc.com or AndrewCarmellini.com.
  
  

NoHo Hospitality Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer
  
More detail about Leuca part of NoHo Hospitality Group
